result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry Donell Ball was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Pay supervision fees.

No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
DEFENDANT TO HAVE NO CONTACT WITH OR POSSESSION OF ANY ANIMALS FOR THE PERIOD OF 5 YEARS.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; 20 days are to be served now, court will allow work release privileges on the 20 days; the remaining 40 days is STAYED pending review.
Defendant to report in for the 20 days no later than 10/27/2015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry Donell Ball

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Henry Donell Ball in court with attorney Brendan Corcoran.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Bail Refund Packets

Defendant Henry Donell Ball in court with attorney Brendan Corcoran.  Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
As to count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.
Sentencing continued.....

 Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; 20 days are to be served now, court will allow work release privileges on the 20 days; the remaining 40 days is STAYED pending review.  Defendant to report in for the 20 days no later than 10/27/2015.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- DEFENDANT TO HAVE NO CONTACT WITH OR POSSESSION OF ANY ANIMALS FOR THE PERIOD OF 5 YEARS.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-20-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Henry Donell Ball in court with attorney Brendan Corcoran.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Henry Donell Ball in court with attorney Brendan Corcoran.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the defendant to return to court on Monday with counsel.  
  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Henry Donell Ball in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared PRO SE. Defendant has not retained counsel. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding retaining counsel. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Court granted additional time to retain counsel. Case adjourend to branch 36.  Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Henry Donell Ball in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in court PRO SE. Defendant requests time to retain counsel in this matter. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502, court suspended time limits as to right of substitution until next court date when defendant appears with counsel. Case adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM028141  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-06-15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sonya B. and Joanne L.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. DEFENSE MOVES TO DISMISS DOMESTIC VIOLENCE ENHANCER. Argumements heard and denied by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.

Defendant Henry Donell Ball in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Henry Donell Ball in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin. bj 
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
